Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage’s ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage’s management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.
In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a “living document”. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage employees, but allows for fe

ic Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 28,000 lbs. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage’s emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- California “Emergency Action Plan” – Title 8 CCR §3220
- Federal “Emergency Action Plan” - Title 29 CFR §1910.38

Strategically, we will respond “minimally” to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency

1.2.6 Process Classification

The ammonia refrigeration system at Sunmet Packing & Cold Storage consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Sunmet Packing & Cold Storage is treated as a single process.

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Sunmet Packing & Cold Storage operates a commercial cold storage for fresh produce in McFarland, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:

(5) Cold Storage Rooms
(6) Precool Rooms
(1) Loading Dock

1.2.2 Facility Location

Sunmet Packing & Cold Storage is located at 32324 Famoso Rd, McFarland, CA 93250. The latitude and longitude of the machinery room is 35.602553, -119.194540. The facility is located approximately 1 mile east of state highway 99 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agricultural land.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in “a special flood hazard area”.
Sunmet Packing & Cold Storage is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps showed that faults within close proximity are not considered high risk:
Poso Creek Fault: <1,600,000 years
Premier Fault: <150 years
Kern Front Fault: <150 years
Kern Gorge Fault: <1,300,000 years

The threat of fault rupture is lower than other areas of Southern California. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Sunmet Packing & Cold Storage has a 2-5% chance of experiencing “potentially minor-damage” due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Description of Covered Process

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program – Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) – Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a “living document”. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Sunmet Packing and Cold Storage has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                          | Process Chemical                       | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration          Anhydrous Ammonia                  28,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have:
